import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Link model issue to app"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/issues/for/models/{modelIssueId}/link/app/{appId}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Links a model-issue association to an external app so the app can surface or manage the model-specific issue. Use this when an integration needs visibility into model-level issue mappings.

**Prerequisites**
1. **modelIssueId** - Use [POST /api/v1.0/issues/for/models/link](/docs/api/model-issues/search-model-issues) and extract `Items[].ModelIssueId`.
2. **appId** - Use the app's registration identifier from your integration settings.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the model-issue association to link.
2. [POST /api/v1.0/issues/for/models/\{modelIssueId\}/link/app/\{appId\}](/docs/api/model-issues/link-model-issue-to-app).
3. Verify the app now sees the model issue in its catalog.

**Minimal Required Fields**: modelIssueId and appId (path).

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"name":"modelIssueId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}},{"name":"appId","in":"path","required":true,"schema":{"type":"string"}}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
